thread.title: What You Just Forgot May Be ‘Sleeping’
thread.title_full: What You Just Forgot May Be ‘Sleeping’

author: aviflax
title: What You Just Forgot May Be ‘Sleeping’
text:
Mind and Matter: Susan Pinker What You Just Forgot May Be ‘Sleeping’ Can’t remember what you were just thinking about? A new study amends our understanding of how memory works By Susan Pinker Jan. 5, 2017 11:20 a.m. ET 
If you’ve ever forgotten why you just entered a room, you know how fickle memory can be. One moment it’s obvious why you walked down the hall, and the next moment you’re standing there befuddled. 
Here today, gone in a millisecond. At least that’s how we used to think about short-term, or working, memory. But a study just published in the journal Science tells a different story. A recent idea or word that you’re trying to recall has... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Popular on WSJ
